thread.title: Virgin CEO: Bush Is Our Teddy Roosevelt
thread.title_full: Virgin CEO: Bush Is Our Teddy Roosevelt

title: Virgin CEO: Bush Is Our Teddy Roosevelt
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
28 Sep 2015 05:16 PM EST 
On Monday billionaire Sir Richard Brandson and astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson got together at the Clinton Global Initiative to chat about the future of space innovation, dropping out of college, and President George W. Bush’s legacy. Branson told Tyson that he believes the history books will overlook the double-war legacy of President Bush in favor of his work in environmental conservation. Branson the CEO of Virgin Group, said, “he’s going to be remembered for creating the largest marine reserve in Hawaii.” Branson was referring to the 140,000-square-mile sanctuary and three additional monuments that Bush designated in 2006 and 2009. DeGrasse Tyson seemed to agree, offering another historical example: When we think of “Teddy Roosevelt—we think of national parks.”
